Position: Sr. Unix System Analyst
Location: Trans Canada Credit - Information Systems 3 Concorde Gate, Don Mills
Posting Date: February 28, 2002 Closing Date: March 8, 2002
This position is responsible for supporting the Unix network and environment, including installation, maintenance, trouble-shooting and problem-solving, disaster planning, security, upgrades, future planning of server hardware and software needs.
Specific Duties and Responsibilities
Performs UNIX environmental planning for projects (including technologies, communication networks, capacities, analysis and implementation).
Conducts internal/external data communications analysis in concert with network analysts, for the design and implementation of a robust UNIX environment.
Co-ordinates and prepares the hardware/software and communications infrastructure documentation. Provides architectural schematics and descriptions of configurations. Maintains detailed documentation of server architectures and configurations for the purposes of support and Disaster Recovery.
Monitors and controls the performance and status of all UNIX servers (AIX/Sun Solaris).
Maintains and recommends hardware technologies, configurations, and upgrades. Maintains and recommends software technologies, configuration, standards, and evaluations. Installs and customizes more complex “off the shelf” and “custom-coded” products. Designs and implements software and hardware configuration.
Provides Disaster Recovery support by maintaining detailed documentation, ensuring back-up systems are operative, and taking disaster recovery into consideration when designing or implementing upgrades.
Provides on-call support.
Knowledge, Experience, Skills
Requires university/college graduate with a minimum of five years of experience in a systems environment at an analyst level, or equivalent work experience. Certification on AIX with exposure to MVS is preferred. Expertise with TCP/IP, HTTP, Websphere.and MQ Series required. Strong interpersonal, communication, trouble shooting and problem solving skills. Ability to handle shifting priorities in a frequently changing environment.
Qualified candidates should contact Katherine Karbownik at local 5314.
